Tucson and Night Shift were practically brothers, if not for their differen=
t colors.  The same kind of courage embraced by Tucson Prime, sticks firmly=
 to Night Shift who continues to dodge the fire thrown at him.  This was it=
, he wasn't going to run scared anymore.  Instead, he was going to use his =
quick thinking, agility and skill to the best of his abilities and he was g=
oing to fight back.  Several compartments on his right gauntlett now reveal=
 a string of tazer like shirukens which when come in contact with metal, de=
liver a nasty sting.  He says not one word, dodging, ducking, crouching and=
 finally tossing a couple of shirukens which sail quickly toward his assail=
ents with dead accuracy!  They weren't enough to immobilize but they were e=
nough to cause some pain.

" Well, I'm stuck here so I might as well make y=
our lives more miserable while I'm down here.  Trust me, I'm really good at=
 it too!"

One thing that DID separate him from Tucson, was his ability to =
be a wize aft.  He transforms back into SUV mode, and dumps a good amount o=
f oil on the floor, just to make things a bit slick for his enemies.

" HAV=
E A NICE TRIP PUNKS!"

Outside, Tucson Prime grows more annoyed at Cyclonus=
's voice.  He wasn't there to give up, he was there to take back something =
that was stolen from the Autobot Matrix of Leadership.  A power he had no r=
ight to command, a power he had no right to steal.  But yelling back wouldn=
't do him any favors.  Rat Trap and Quickstride look to him.

"What now Whe=
els?"

Tucson Prime looks to his comrades.

" I - have a feeling it's somet=
hing a little more spiritual than just yelling his name.."

He then replies=
 to Kup.

"Kup, I need you here at the Black Fortress.  Bring plenty of sta=
sis cuffs with you, you'll need them.  Shell program or no shell program, w=
e're taking Rodimus, Nightlight and Windlord back with us.  As soon as we c=
apture them, I'll need you and Lord Elder to get them to Kenzo at the old M=
aximal base.  Something tells me that the answers we seek, lies within our =
own confines.  I don't know why, but it's just a feeling I have."

He then =
closes his eyes, to delve deeper into the power of the Matrix which he hold=
s within him.

" Primus, give me the strength to take back what has been wr=
ongfully taken from us.  A power which Cyclonus had no right to steal. A po=
wer that is earned and not taken.  He has betrayed you Primus, he has betra=
yed the one commandment that all Autobot kind has abided by for centuries. =
 I am here to redeem what has been wrongfully stolen from Rodimus Prime.  P=
lease, grant me the power to accomplish my plight."

Rat Trap and Quick Str=
ide watch with slight confusion.

" Huh? I thought he was gonna really ratt=
le the parameter.  What's he waitn' for?"

Quickstride also looks on with c=
onfusion.

"Ummm, you're askn' the wrong Maximal. But I bet Lord Elder woul=
d know why."

Tucson remains in a trance like state, attempting to connect =
with the power within his body.

Rat Trap quickly transmits the events to L=
ord Elder via video link.

"Lord Elder, we're here, but we dunno what's go'=
n down with Tucson Prime.  Cyclonus asked 'em a question and I thought for =
sure he was gonna go after him with a vengeance.  But he didn't.  He's righ=
t here, in some sorta trance like state.  Hope those creepoids didn't get i=
nside his directory. Quickstride, how is he?"

Quickstride shrugs.

" Nothn=
' yet Rat Trap, he's in deep thought.  Sir, we dunno what ta make of this, =
we never saw anything like this before.  Got any idea what's going on?"

Th=
ey look to the video com link device on Rat Trap's arm as they wait for an =
answer.
--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> =
wrote:

> Who: CYCLONUS, DARK RODIMUS
> Location: Black Fortress - Securit=
y
> 
> Rodimus looked over at Cyclonus, his crimson optics glittering coldl=
y
> as he observed the ex-minion, his gaze difficult to read.
> 
> Rodimus'=
 frame was tall and straight, and although he had once been
> redesigned as=
 a Prime, there was still something about his build that
> was still lean, =
as if built for endurance and speed. His armor, even
> in the bright lights=
 of the security chamber, still somehow maintained
> it's stark black on gr=
ay motif, stylized flames dancing across his
> chest.
> 
> He glanced over =
at one of the screens, the one that was displaying the
> activity outside w=
ith Tuscon and the other Autobot rabble standing
> there as if expecting th=
em to open the base up and let them in.
> Rodimus chuckled softly for a mom=
ent, earning him a brief glance from
> Cyclonus. Rodimus was about to say s=
omething when Hydras' voice cut in
> . . .
> 
> > "We are under attack!!!!!=
 We must to capture Nightshift, pronto!!!! Scourge and Cyclonus active the =
inner and exterior defenses... If the Autobot leaves the base we will be fo=
rced to go to a fight"
> 
> Cyclonus tilted his head curiously as he, and R=
odimus for that matter,
> looked at the screen that displayed the screen in=
 the throne room and
> the mayhem that was going on.
> 
> "Sir!?" Cyclonus =
sent to Hydras, "The base has been submerged
> underneath the magma and I a=
m activating the interior defenses."
> 
> Even as Cyclonus talked, a privat=
e message came to Rodimus from Hydras . . .
> 
> > "cover the reseach lab, =
if the autobot ran towards it, intercept him"
> 
> Rodimus acknowledged Hyd=
ras' message as he glanced up at Cyclonus. He
> hadn't appeared to notice t=
he message that Hydras sent. "I have some
> things to attend to." Rodimus s=
aid, his voice calm and yet still that
> undercurrent of aggression was sti=
ll in it. "I'll be back."
> 
> Without another word Rodimus left the room, =
on his way to the research
> lab . . . and Nightlight.
> 
> Cyclonus nodded=
 as Rodimus left and then turned back to his consoles
> and screens, anothe=
r lit up beside him as he activated it, this one
> watching Rodimus. Cyclon=
us had indeed been aware of the communication
> Rodimus had received, and h=
e watched his progress with keen interest,
> even as he kept an optic on th=
e other events.
